required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Safety and Efficacy of RVL-1201 in the Treatment of Blepharoptosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled Phase 3 Study of the Safety and Efficacy of RVL-1201 in the Treatment of Acquired Blepharoptosis

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 3 study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of treatment with RVL-1201 compared to placebo for treatment of blepharoptosis. Eligible subjects will be randomized to one of 2 treatment arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Number of Points Seen on the Leicester Peripheral Field Test (LPFT) in RVL-1201 Group vs. Vehicle Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mean change from Baseline (Day 1, Hour 0) compared with Day 1, (Hour 6), and Day 14 (Hour 2)
primary_outcome.description: LPFT Total Score is the number of points seen in the top 4 rows on the LPFT. Possible scores range from 0 (no points seen) to 35 (all points seen).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Marginal Reflex Distance (MRD) in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline Day 1 (Hour 0) and Day 1, Day 14, and Day 42
secondary_outcome.description: The Marginal Reflex Distance (MRD) is the distance from the center pupillary light reflex to the central margin of the upper eyelid. The MRD is measured from an external photograph using a handheld caliper and a millimeter ruler label placed on the subject's forehead as a measurement legend.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or Female 9 years of age or older
2. Females must not be pregnant or planning to get pregnant and must use acceptable form of contraception
3. Must be able to self-administer study medication
4. Must be able to understand and sign an informed consent form. For minor subjects, the subject's parent or legal guardian must provide permission by signing an ICF on behalf of the subject and the subject should provide assent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Congenital ptosis
2. Horner syndrome
3. Myasthenia gravis
4. Mechanical ptosis
5. Previous ptosis surgery
6. Resting heart rate outside the normal range
7. Hypertension with resting diastolic blood pressure
8. Pregnancy or lactation

facility.name: Medical Center Ophthalmology Assocs - Keystone Research

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Planned sample size was approximately 156 subjects, 104 subjects in the RVL-1201 group, and 52 in the Vehicle group, to be enrolled at approximately 30 clinical sites in the U.S.

group.title: RVL-1201 Ophthalmic Solution 0.1%
group.description: RVL-1201 (oxymetazoline hydrochloride) ophthalmic solution 0.1% One drop each eye once-daily in the morning

group.title: Vehicle Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: Vehicle placebo ophthalmic Solution One drop each eye once-daily in the morning

group.title: RVL-1201 Ophthalmic Solution 0.1%
group.description: RVL-1201 (oxymetazoline hydrochloride) ophthalmic solution 0.1% One drop each eye QD in the morning

group.title: Vehicle Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: Vehicle placebo ophthalmic Solution One drop each eye QD in the morning

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Mean Change in Number of Points Seen on the Leicester Peripheral Field Test (LPFT) in RVL-1201 Group vs. Vehicle Group
outcome.description: LPFT Total Score is the number of points seen in the top 4 rows on the LPFT. Possible scores range from 0 (no points seen) to 35 (all points seen).
outcome.time_frame: Mean change from Baseline (Day 1, Hour 0) compared with Day 1, (Hour 6), and Day 14 (Hour 2)
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population: randomized who received at least one dose. Per-Protocol Population (PPP): ITT population with no major protocol deviations (eleven subjects were excluded). ITT analysis was conducted for the primary endpoint, with Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for missing data.

group.title: RVL-1201 Ophthalmic Solution 0.1%
group.description: RVL-1201 (oxymetazoline hydrochloride) ophthalmic solution 0.1% One drop each eye QD in the morning

group.title: Vehicle Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: Vehicle placebo ophthalmic Solution One drop each eye QD in the morning

measure.title: Mean Change in Number of Points Seen on the Leicester Peripheral Field Test (LPFT) in RVL-1201 Group vs. Vehicle Group
measure.description: LPFT Total Score is the number of points seen in the top 4 rows on the LPFT. Possible scores range from 0 (no points seen) to 35 (all points seen).
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population: randomized who received at least one dose. Per-Protocol Population (PPP): ITT population with no major protocol deviations (eleven subjects were excluded). ITT analysis was conducted for the primary endpoint, with Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for missing data.

class.title: Mean change from baseline LPFT-Day 1 Hour 6
Mean change from baseline LPFT-Day 14 Hour 2

analysis.groups_desc: A two group t-test with a 0.05 two-sided significance level had 90% power to detect a difference in LPFT means of 3.50 assuming that the common standard deviation was 6.0, when the sample sizes in the 2 groups were 94 and 47, respectively (a total sample size of 141).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The primary efficacy endpoints were tested sequentially. The Day 1 Hour 6 time point was tested first and if P<0.05, the Day 14 Hour 2 time point was tested at a significance level of 0.05. If the Day 1 Hour 6 endpoint is statistically significant (at the 0.05 level) but Day 14 Hour 2 was not statistically significant (at the 0.05 level), the study will still be considered positive.
analysis.p_value_desc: If both primary endpoints (LPFT) are significant at 0.05 significance level, then the secondary efficacy endpoints (MRD) were also tested sequentially. Testing stopped if a P≥ 0.05 for a comparison.
analysis.method_desc: 2 sided t-test with treatment as fixed factor and baseline as covariate.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Marginal Reflex Distance (MRD) in the Study Eye
outcome.description: The Marginal Reflex Distance (MRD) is the distance from the center pupillary light reflex to the central margin of the upper eyelid. The MRD is measured from an external photograph using a handheld caliper and a millimeter ruler label placed on the subject's forehead as a measurement legend.

outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population: randomized who received at least one dose. ITT analysis was conducted for the primary endpoint, with Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for missing data.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent adverse events (AEs) were assessed at Baseline through Day 42 (end of study).
reported_events.desc: AEs spontaneously reported by the subject and/or in response to an open questions from the study personnel or revealed by observation were recorded in the eCRF.

group.title: RVL-1201 Ophthalmic Solution, 0.1%
group.description: One drop each eye QD in the morning (n=109)

group.title: Vehicle Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: One drop each eye QD in the morning (n=55)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
